website_summaries.verdict: HP's OfficeJet 6110 offers quality printing, copying, and scanning services for the small office, but it may disappoint those who depend on faxing.
pros: good print quality and top-notch grayscale scans

customer_reviews.title: It's worked great for our family for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised by the variety of bad experiences some have had with this printer as it's worked like a charm for my family and me for almost 4 years now. I use the duplexer attachment, and refill the cartridges by syringe with bulk ink by Inktec or Stratitec, so it's almost printing for free. A half liter bottle for $25 will last nearly forever! The Fast Normal setting does great quality, so speed is not a problem. The paper never jams. The fax is so easy to use. It's wonderful to have a home photocopier, b/w or color. Maybe HP doesn't make them as good as this anymore, but in my opinion they hit a home run on this model.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fane

customer_reviews.title: This baby is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today. Flawless setup, copied, scanned, faxed great and faster than expected. It is a very good looking printer setting on your desk and has a lot of options. Only drawback I see is that the ink cartridges are freaking small, so I doubt they'll last very long. Seems to be a better printer than dad's G95 printer which I thought would be hard to beat. Also is cool you can feed it one envelope for addressing through a special slot for fast printing (have to remove paper for multiple envelopes)
customer_reviews.author: J. Berning

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to print
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how they could possibly say that this is 19 ppm. It has a "fast" copy mode but it still takes about 2 minutes and that is for a faint gray copy. I didn't have a digital copier at all before so it's still nice to have. I have sent a fax, printed in color, scanned and copied from the document feeder. Also, you will have to buy a duplexer if you want it to copy on both sides and I think they are $80-100. That was an unpleasant surprise as well. Since it is cheap it is a pretty good deal but I really thought it was going to be sooo fast and it's just not.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Sterne

customer_reviews.title: Was a pretty good machine but ended up having problems with it. Have a new one for  a couple of years now.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product when I had it, although it was years ago. I did have problems with it after a few years and my husband took it apart and fixed it. I have long since had to buy a new one which I like much better.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas Girl

customer_reviews.title: usual hp quality
customer_reviews.text: Only had this a day, and I'm no expert, but this seems to have the usual quality and ease-of-use that HP delivers. So far, so good. My only quibble was that there didn't seem to be a (necessary) USB cable included in the box. I had a spare, so I ended my evening happily enough...
customer_reviews.author: E K Stackler

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Broke during shipping. Needed the install disk that wasn't included.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Never recieved this item.
customer_reviews.text: This Seller was terrible I never received the printer and never received a response on why is has not come.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Harris

customer_reviews.title: quick fix
customer_reviews.text: I've had it several years, and it's worked pretty well for me. My need for a printer is minimal, so take that for what it's worth. I use it very little. Recently it stopped working. I called HP and their tech support said it was bad hardware, and just replace it. I was looking for a new replacement, when I stumbled on the website for software downloads. Yes, that's right, I re-installed the software for it, and it immediately started working correctly again. Just a thought for anyone having problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: justgreenleaf

customer_reviews.title: I hope we are just as satisfied. The new printer will be a back up ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this machine almost 20 years ago. Whenever I think it's finally dead it clears whatever issue it has and keeps on printing. HP made a trusty printer back in the day. This old printer has paid for itself at least twice.The scanner is now not scanning as crisp as it used to but it still prints, copies, faxes and prints a decent photo. "It takes a licking and keeps on ticking". Just ordered another HP printer 8000 series. I hope we are just as satisfied. The new printer will be a back up for the day when "Old faithful" finally decides to be put to rest.
customer_reviews.author: swimmom

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.  Too bad it has so many problems.
customer_reviews.text: This is fax machine, copier, printer and scanner all in one. That's an excellent idea and three weeks after I started using this machine, I wrote a rave review. Not long after that, however, it started acting funky. The printing -- when jobs actually went through -- went from very fast to cranking out one page every three minutes (reserve a few hours if you have any large documents to print). The copier was temperamental. The scanning function has never worked properly. The tech support is not helpful, they tend to have only about two solutions per problem and if those don't work, such is life.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Quilty

customer_reviews.title: Took It Back For A Refund Just In Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because I wanted the flat glass for the copy function. However, it wasn't worth it. This printer tries to do too much, is cheaply made, and has a user-unfriendly menu. The software is full of bugs. You will be spending many hours trying to figure things out and calling India where customer service seems to be located. I was very lucky to get it back to the store within ten days for a full refund. And as you might figure, the store was a pain in the neck and said that they couldn't believe that I was having trouble with this model. Duh!
customer_reviews.author: G. Reid

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this machine. Why? The scanner doesn't work right, and the resolution is horrible--it won't pick up faint images. The drivers don't mesh well with Mac OS X users, and it has problems printing. It faxes and copies well--that's just about it. Oh, and the lid is so heavy, it'll crash down on itself if you don't support it all the way when closing--Unlike Canon's counterbalanced machines. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Mopar guy

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten one of the good ones!!!
customer_reviews.text: I, too, am surprised at the number of negative reviews for this printer. I have had this product since it was first released several years ago. I am a CPA and work in my home office via a virtual office connection (Atlanta to Dallas). It is a workhorse with a sheetfeeder that works great for scanning and emailing work related documentation in .pdf files, receiving or sending faxes and printing labels/letters/envelopes. I want to replace it with a Samsung Laser printer but there is no justifiable business reason to do it. My experience has been that it is a really great printer!!! I'll feed my piggy bank instead of replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Mccullough

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanning function of this machine is extremely disappointing. The HP software does not mesh well with Adobe Acrobat at all, if that's what's you're using to create scans. I've uninstalled and reinstalled the software many, many times, and it still acts up. HP doesn't appear to have a fix. The scanner ADF feature doesn't always work well either--and there's a real problem with knowing if 4 or more pages are even going to 'take' or just drop off. The photocopy and FAX functions work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing but praise for this great little printer/fax/scanner/copier
customer_reviews.text: A little known fact about the HP 6110 is that it is the only existing multifunction printer that also does photo quality pix using a photo ink cartridge. These HP prints far outlive other ink-jet output by several decades. These facts are little advertised by HP, for reasons best known to themselves. I'm no employee of HP, just a happy amateur photographer who is thrilled to have one unit doing both office and hobby work with no compromise in quality at an economical price. Oh, and did I mention having 1 printer instead of 2 (one photo, one office) saves a considerable amount of space?
customer_reviews.author: MSC

customer_reviews.title: If it were possible to give zero stars... I would.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this AIO three years ago when it was on sale at a retail store, it seemed like exactly what I wanted. I was running a very small home office and it faxed, copied and scanned... seemed perfect to me, until I actually tried to use it. The drivers are buggy.. the software they make you install is bloatware, slow and prone to unexpectedly quitting. The printer itself jams ALL the time. It chokes on paper and doesn't aligns the sheets... it's hard to get a square print. Overall it was just a very bad experience and I truly wish I hadn't wasted my money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: HP 6110xi Review
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see all the bad reviews of the HP 6110. I bought mine over 2 1/2 years ago. I use it every day in my home office and have never had any trouble at all. I use it to copy (I really like the multiple page feeder), scan photos, copy both color and black and white, fax, and print. I am using an XP-windows based computer. I recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Printer Ever Made!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Printer has never worked correctly, even when new. It freezes the computer, prints lousy, Copies indecipherable, fax only works some of the time. The paper feeder is in a very inconvenient place. Paper always gets jammed. HP discontinued this model very soon after production after a lot of complaints. Made me so mad that I will think twice before I buy any HP products. If you want superior print quality go with an Epson, or Canon. Last week my printer finally shorted out. The fax stopped working made my phones go dead. I can not wait to smash this baby to bits!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: poe

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, you'll be sorry!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my fourth machine. I bought it from Sam's Club and thankfully bought the 3 year extended warranty. I can't begin to list all the problems it's given me. Right now, I can't get it to print. It's done this many times. You have to uninstall the software and reinstall it. It's such a pain! Just save your money and don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: S. Stringham

customer_reviews.title: Quits when you need it the most
customer_reviews.text: Like others, my 6110 stops in the middle of a photo print job. The only way to start it again is to completely remove the s/ware package and reinstall. Then you start the whole process again. A few photos printed and it stops. I'm having a terrible time finding a multifunction that does what I want, when I want. When it works it does a beautiful job, but the trick is to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: 1513th 1963

customer_reviews.title: We have had it for 4 years and still works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer for 4+ yrs. We have overall been very pleased. I have had to uninstall/reinstall software 3 times - so not to bad compared to what others have said. If it ever gives out on us we will for sure look at HP all in one again. I love the features -fax, scan copy, print. It was very useful and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in mid America

customer_reviews.title: Very, very slow, high-maintenance printer
customer_reviews.text: Have wrestled with this printer for a couple of years in my home. Am finally abandoning it. It's horribly slow and I've had to reinstall the software about a half dozen times. And I am an HP printer guy. Every printer in my company is an HP and they all work well. This one model, though, is a disaster. Don't buy it. Especially not a used one.
customer_reviews.author: JK Oregon

customer_reviews.title: HP Officejet 6110
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews and a recommendation from the salesman at Office Depot I decided to purchase this unit. I installed it today in about an hour. I have tried all the functions, send and receive faxes, scanning, printing, and copying. I am very impressed with the quality of the unit and it's output. Everything worked, even better than I expected. I am using Windows XP
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Bad machine
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for a little over one year. I frequently had technical issues with it, it didn't seem to like my Mac powerbook. Then, a couple weeks ago it stopped working, displaying a error message "Check printer cartridge." Which I did, to no avail. Their web support page went through a series of suggestions, including cleaning the cartridge slots, which I did. Their final suggestion was to buy a new set of cartridges, and if that didn't work, the unit would need servicing. Needless to say, I was a chump and wasted over 30 bucks on a new cartridge and the unit still doesn't work. And its out of warranty, so its not worth fixing. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: NYCDOC

customer_reviews.title: Could easily become a five star
customer_reviews.text: This machine has everything I was looking for: multifunction, automatic document feeder, envelope slot, ability to copy legal size (through the ADF only, flatbed is only up to letter size) and reasonably priced compared to competitors' models. I'd suggest that HP put a backlight on the display, make the fax setup instructions a little more user friendly and change to separate ink tanks from the 3 color cartridge. I've only had it only 1 week, so I can't comment on how long the ink will last. So far I have faxed, copied, scanned and printed photos as well as text. All is great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Overall good multifunction unit despite few problems
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this multifunction unit for over 3 years now. I have found the print to be excellent and very economical on ink. The scans are very good although the software wants to include a border on some scans which is irritating. The multi-document feeder is OK but tends to take multiple sheets on one pass. As a result - you can't really trust the MDF - which is one of the reasons I got the unit. Overall mechanically - it seems to be a good unit for the money. Software wise - leave somethings to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a constant frustration. Out of the box, the software is buggy and has never worked right. Tech support is poor, and they are able to do little more than parrot the instructions that come with the machine. Constantly jams when sending faxes, freezes up when sending large faxes, and has never successfully scanned an item. I operate a small business and thought this machine would cover several bases at once, but have been constantly disappointed. HP should be ashamed for putting this garbage on the market.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Best features of the printer are the auto paper feed above the flat bed scanner, the auto paper sensing (knew that I had left labels in the document feeder when a fax came in and asked me to insert paper so it didn't waste a sheet of labels for a fax...pretty sweet), great job printing professional glossy documents, fast, and reasonable lasting print cartridges. The only thing I miss about my 2210 is the camera memory slots for uploading picutres.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan E. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Carriage Jam Error
customer_reviews.text: I bought my HP 6110 about 18 months ago. It has always been a noisy printer, and the ADF never worked that well. Recently there has been lots of carriage noise, and now a "carriage jam" error shows up. I've checked it out several times, no jam I can see. Back to CompUSA for an exchange tomorrow under my 2 year extended warranty. I'll be selecting another printer,not the 6110, but I haven't figured out which yet. It will be a Canon or Epson, hope I make the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a replacement for another unit. Both units stopped working in the first 3 months of service. I will send the 6110 back to HP and figure it was an expensive lesson. The customer support is a joke. After a week of exchanging emails on how to fix the problem, I was told to contact a real person. The real person then took me thru the same procedures and it still won't work. Guess I will look for another brand to buy. This is my fourth HP product that has failed. Two HP 6110's and two Pavillion computers.
customer_reviews.author: Shari D. Holland

customer_reviews.title: HP is not my choice
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time PC user. I have purchased HP, Cannon and Epson printers. I will never purchase HP or Cannon again having learned my lesson with software and installation of HP and to a lessor degree, Cannon. Epson shines and is always my first choice. Seems like users need to access support quite frequently with HP products, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Chili

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for small business use. Within three months I had to exchange it (fo the same model). Now, a month later, I am looking for a replacement and a different brand... save yourself the trouble and look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Machine!
customer_reviews.text: It's been nothing but trouble. It jams constantly. I have to baby sit each page as it comes out!!! The scanning is bad as someone else describes. It's not very compatiable with MACs. I wanted to like HP products, but this has killed that in me. I will NEVER buy HP again. This is just crazy. I'm goning to have to toss it and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bertolone

customer_reviews.title: Good printer. Drivers did not install properly at first.
customer_reviews.text: Good printer. Drivers did not install properly at first and required several calls to HP's help desk. Not that it works, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Multifunction Printer
customer_reviews.text: I pruchased this unit so I could make copies for Sunday School and do light faxing and scanning. I have to use the unit increasingly for scanning documents into my computer. So far, I have had no problems to report on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and money
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these thinking the automatic feeder would save me loads of time. Now instead of minutes it takes hours. HP's tech support's only advise was to buy more equipment and to reboot my computer. I thought they realized we outgrew that trick 10 years ago. When I tell the machine to read from the feeder it reads from the flatbed and vise versa. Don't spend your money on this untested product. The only nice thing I can say about this product is that if you can keep it working for more than 1.4 minutes it can print four pages on one sheet of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bray

customer_reviews.title: hp 6110 is a POS
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this printer, or anything from hp. Their customer support is horrible, the printer is a POS. Mine didnt even last a year. They told me they dont even have the parts to fix my printer, and they would sell me another one for $260.00. Yeah sure, I will be right there!!!! Not a chance. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: D. Swafford

customer_reviews.title: HP 6110 all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: Great Machine................ What a great surprise, after reading about all the problems with other machines(both HP, Canon, Brother, Epson etc...) I was really expecting some problems with setup and use. What a great suprise, the setup was easy and painless. All the functions work without any problems. I have had the machine for 2 months, I use MS XP. Pat
customer_reviews.author: Pat Kosinski

customer_reviews.title: Great product...for a little over 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Same as many other reviews. This all-in-one worked great until one day the dreaded "carrier jam" appeared. Seems that many owners experience this total melt down with this printer. It should be called an all-OR-NONE, since it will not print, scan, fax or copy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy
customer_reviews.text: something is always freezing, not working, or conflicting. also, a slow machine. go for something newer.
customer_reviews.author: MReadr

customer_reviews.title: weak
customer_reviews.text: Had this machine for 6 months and hate it. Loud and annoying. Very buggy and difficult overall to manage Waste of money. Next time I'll read these reviews.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: HP 6110
customer_reviews.text: I JUSY GOT THIS MULTIFUNCTION HP 6110 YESTERDAY AND LOVE IT. SET UP WAS EASY,ALL THE FUNCTIONS WORK GREAT. I HOOKED THE FAX TO MY PHONE LINE AND IT WORKS GOOD, EXCEPT CAN,T USE THE PHONE WHILE RECIEVING OR SENDING A FAX BUT I CAN LIVE WITH THAT. THE PHOTO QUALITY ON THIS MACHINE IS VERY GOOD, I USED PHOTO PAPER, DID,NT EVEN USE THE NUMBER 58 INK, THOUGH I GOT IT JUST INCASE I DO NEED IT IN THE FUTURE.HOPE IT CONTINUES TO PERFORM WELL..
customer_reviews.author: DAVID SCIGLIANO

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had problem after problem with the HP 6110 All-In-One. It started with the paper jamming and eventually it stopped printing alltogether because it "claims" that its out of paper. Another great example of poorly engineered American electronics. THIS PRINTER IS PATHETIC!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Demarco

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This machine has been trouble from day one! Scanning and faxing are problematic at best, and then the printing often refuses to work after that until some combination of power cycles and computer reboots. I love HP but I hate this POS machine!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Same as the rest ok till a jam
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok till fax feeder jamed. 1 week trying to fix it will probably give up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Broggi

product_meta.title: HP OfficeJet 6110 All-in-One Multifunction
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
Note: The HP OfficeJet 6110 is no longer being manufactured. You may want to consider purchasing the newer HP OfficeJet 6210 instead. 

 With beautiful, optimized color and fast copying and printing speeds, the convenient, space-saving HP OfficeJet 6110 multifunction is ready to help you. It can handle projects ranging from copying multipage documents in sharp laser quality to printing borderless 4-by-6-inch color snapshots. Equipped with a 35-page automatic document feeder, the HP OfficeJet 6110 gives you complete functionality so you can turn your attention to other tasks while printing, faxing, scanning, and copying.

 Professional-looking documents are assured, thanks to 1,200 x 1,200 dpi print and copy resolution, and 2,400 x 1,200 dpi scan resolution with true 48-bit color. Plus, get your documents fast, with up 19 pages per minute (ppm) copying speed. The convenient USB interface is quick to connect and the software is easy to set up. The unit is backed by a one-year product warranty.
feature_bullets: 1,200 x 1,200 dpi print and copy resolution

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars94 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
